1.name: Bonnie and Clyde
1.description: Bored waitress Bonnie Parker falls in love with an ex-con named Clyde Barrow and together they start a violent crime spree through the country, stealing cars and robbing banks.

2.name: Doctor Dolittle
2.description: After the animal communicating veterinarian goes too far for his clientele, he and his friends escape their hometown to the sea in search of the Great Pink Sea Snail.

3.name: The Graduate
3.description: A disillusioned college graduate finds himself torn between his older lover and her daughter.

4.name: The Dirty Dozen
4.description: During World War II, a rebellious U.S. Army Major is assigned a dozen convicted murderers to train and lead them into a mass assassination mission of German officers.

5.name: The Jungle Book
5.description: Bagheera the Panther and Baloo the Bear have a difficult time trying to convince a boy to leave the jungle for human civilization.

6.name: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
6.description: A couple's attitudes are challenged when their daughter introduces them to her African-American fiancé.

7.name: Casino Royale
7.description: In an early spy spoof, aging Sir James Bond comes out of retirement to take on SMERSH.

8.name: In the Heat of the Night
8.description: An African-American police detective is asked to investigate a murder in a racially hostile southern town.

9.name: Cool Hand Luke
9.description: A laid back Southern man is sentenced to two years in a rural prison, but refuses to conform.

10.name: El Dorado
10.description: Cole Thornton, a gunfighter for hire, joins forces with an old friend, Sheriff J.P. Hara. Together with an old Indian fighter and a gambler, they help a rancher and his family fight a rival rancher that is trying to steal their water.

11.name: Valley of the Dolls
11.description: Film version of Jacqueline Susann's best-selling novel chronicling the rise and fall of three young women in show business.

12.name: Dance of the Vampires
12.description: A noted professor and his dim-witted apprentice fall prey to their inquiring vampires, while on the trail of the ominous damsel in distress.

13.name: You Only Live Twice
13.description: Secret Agent James Bond and the Japanese Secret Service must find and stop the true culprit of a series of space hijackings, before war is provoked between Russia and the United States.

14.name: The St. Valentine's Day Massacre
14.description: Al Capone's Valentine's Day surprise for the rival Bugs Moran gang in 1929 Chicago.

15.name: The Incident
15.description: Late one night, two young toughs hold hostage the passengers in one car of a New York subway train.

16.name: The Producers
16.description: A stage-play producer devises a plan to make money by producing a sure-fire flop.

17.name: Belle de jour
17.description: A frigid young housewife decides to spend her midweek afternoons as a prostitute.

18.name: Barefoot in the Park
18.description: Paul, a conservative young lawyer, marries the vivacious Corie. Their highly passionate relationship descends into comical discord in a five-flight New York City walk-up apartment.

19.name: Le samouraï
19.description: After professional hitman Jef Costello is seen by witnesses his efforts to provide himself an alibi drive him further into a corner.

20.name: The War Wagon
20.description: The story of a man who was shot, robbed and imprisoned who returns to steal a large gold shipment from the man who wronged him. The gold is transported in an armored stage coach, the War Wagon.

21.name: Far from the Madding Crowd
21.description: Bathsheba Everdene, a willful, flirtatious, young woman, unexpectedly inherits a large farm and is romantically pursued by three very different men.

22.name: Playtime
22.description: Monsieur Hulot curiously wanders around a high-tech Paris, paralleling a trip with a group of American tourists. Meanwhile, a nightclub/restaurant prepares its opening night, but it's still under construction.

23.name: Fathom
23.description: In Spain, an American skydiver is recruited by Western intelligence agents to recover a lost H-bomb detonator from hostile foreign agents.

24.name: To Sir, with Love
24.description: Idealistic engineer-trainee and his experiences in teaching a group of rambunctious white high school students from the slums of London's East End.

25.name: The Born Losers
25.description: Billy Jack battles outlaw motorcycle gang in a small California beach town.

26.name: In Cold Blood
26.description: After a botched robbery results in the brutal murder of a rural family, two drifters elude police, in the end coming to terms with their own mortality and the repercussions of their vile atrocity.

27.name: I Call First
27.description: J.R. is a typical Italian-American on the streets of New York. When he gets involved with a local girl, he decides to get married and settle down, but when he learns that she was once raped...                See full summary »

28.name: I'll Never Forget What's'isname
28.description: The professional and romantic misadventures of an advertising executive in 1960s swinging London.

29.name: The Way West
29.description: In 1843, a former U.S. Senator leads a wagon train of settlers to Oregon, but his megalomania leads to growing dissatisfaction with his leadership.

30.name: Wait Until Dark
30.description: A recently blinded woman is terrorized by a trio of thugs while they search for a heroin-stuffed doll they believe is in her apartment.

31.name: Point Blank
31.description: After being double-crossed and left for dead, a mysterious man named Walker single-mindedly tries to retrieve the money that was stolen from him.

32.name: Hombre
32.description: John Russell, disdained by his "respectable" fellow stagecoach passengers because he was raised by Native Americans, becomes their only hope for survival when they are set upon by outlaws.

33.name: Camelot
33.description: The story of the marriage of England's King Arthur to Guinevere. The plot of illegitimate Mordred to gain the throne and Guinevere's growing attachment to Sir Lancelot, threaten to topple Arthur and destroy his "round table" of knights.

34.name: Two for the Road
34.description: A couple in the south of France non-sequentially spin down the highways of infidelity in their troubled ten-year marriage.

35.name: Viy
35.description: A young priest is ordered to preside over the wake of witch in a small old wooden church of a remote village. This means spending three nights alone with the corpse with only his faith to protect him.

36.name: Thoroughly Modern Millie
36.description: Millie Dillmount (Dame Julie Andrews) comes to town in the roaring twenties to encounter flappers, sexuality, and white slavers.

37.name: Le streghe
37.description: Five short stories loosely dealing with the roles of women in society.

38.name: Chuka
38.description: While Indians besiege a U.S. Army fort in 1876, residents of the fort, a gunfighter, a stagecoach driver, two Mexican women, and a motley company of soldiers, try to come to terms with their pasts.

39.name: A Countess from Hong Kong
39.description: In Hong Kong, the ambassador returning to America meets the Russian countess, a refugee without a passport, who decides to hide in his cabin.

40.name: Quatermass and the Pit
40.description: A mysterious artifact is unearthed in London, and famous scientist Bernard Quatermass is called into to divine its origins and explain its strange effects on people.

41.name: Don't Make Waves
41.description: New York tourist Tony Curtis falls asleep on a Southern California beach on his first night in the West and wakes up to The New Phantasmagoria--catamarans, surfers (including a dog), ...                See full summary »

42.name: A Guide for the Married Man
42.description: A man gives his co-worker a series of lessons on how to cheat on one's wife without being caught.

43.name: The Taming of the Shrew
43.description: Brutish, fortune-hunting scoundrel Petruchio (Richard Burton) tames his wealthy, shrewish wife, Katharina (Dame Elizabeth Taylor).

44.name: Jag är nyfiken - en film i gult
44.description: Lena, aged twenty, wants to know all she can about life and reality. She collects information on everyone and everything, storing her findings in an enormous archive. She experiments with ...                See full summary »

45.name: Bedazzled
45.description: A hapless loser sells his soul to the Devil in exchange for seven wishes, but has trouble winning over the girl of his dreams.

46.name: Les demoiselles de Rochefort
46.description: Two sisters leave their small seaside town of Rochefort in search of romance. Hired as carnival singers, one falls for an American musician, while the other must search for her ideal partner.

47.name: Da uomo a uomo
47.description: A young gunfighter plans to track down and eliminate the bandits who killed his family, and forms a tenuous alliance with an aging ex-outlaw, till the surprising end.

48.name: La collectionneuse
48.description: A womanizing art dealer and a painter find the serenity of their Riviera vacation disturbed by a third guest, a vivacious bohemian woman known for her long list of male conquests.

49.name: Rough Night in Jericho
49.description: A former deputy and a strong-willed widow determine to stop a ruthless town boss.

50.name: Spider Baby or, the Maddest Story Ever Told
50.description: A caretaker devotes himself to three demented siblings after their father's death.
